other_tests.findings: Bilateral high myopia and astigmatism (RE: -9.75DS/-3.50DC*177°, LE: -12.50DS/-3.50DC*12°). Best corrected visual acuity (BCVA) was LogMAR 0.4 (Snellen 20/50) in the right eye and LogMAR 0.54 (Snellen 20/70) in the left eye.
Increased vessel density with reduction of the foveal avascular zone.
Significantly reduced amplitudes were observed on light-adapted ERG and light-adapted 30 Hz ERG bilaterally.
No significant abnormalities were observed in the parents' results.
No significant abnormalities were observed in the patient.
